0: Thanks to Hillary Clinton's new logo for her 2016 presidential bid, graphic design is at the forefront of the American political conversation. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The fate of the United States will clearly all come down to branding (and candidates' takes on the issues, I guess). That's why designer Rick Wolff came up with Hillvetica, inspired by the font used in Clinton's official logo unveiled in a video on Sunday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR If I could afford font software, I'd make & release #Hillvetica, free. Which crowdfunding should I use? pic.twitter.com/SRoigWDGr6 â€” Rick Wolff (@RickWolff) April 14, 2015 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Hillvetica maintains the bold, patriotic red-and-blue color scheme; the arrows are meant to remind you that Hillary is going places. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Wolff is currently working to make Hillvetica a downloadable font, presumably for Hillary supporters to create PowerPoint presentations. There is no word on whether Comic Rands or Times New Rubio are in development.
